2.speaker: Esra
2.text: You two go on ahead. You can still make it in time if you move swiftly.

3.speaker: Esra
3.text: I’ll deal with organizing the carriages for your return trips.

5.text: (He turns to you, his face shifting into a look of disdain.)

6.speaker: Cassius
6.text: Hurry it up. We still have a chance to maintain appearances, don’t mess it up with any more sloppiness.

7.text: (Cassius is reaching out again. What should you do?)

8.options: Let him drag me. Maintaining appearances starts now.|I pull away and rush ahead before he pulls my arm off.

9.speaker: Cassius
9.text: Pick up the pace. It’s like you [i]want[/i] us to be late.

10.speaker: Cassius
10.text: Must you be this difficult now of all days?

11.text: (He looks pissed, but you refuse to give in.)

12.text: (You don’t care if it’s out of character for her. Strange looks are much preferred to a bruised wrist from getting yanked around everywhere.)

13.speaker: Cassius
13.text: You know what, I don’t care any more.

14.speaker: Cassius
14.text: Do whatever pleases you. Just hurry it up.

17.text: (The royal garden is nothing short of beautiful. Perhaps breathtaking is the better term?)

18.text: (It’s a large expanse of land, swallowing the main palace it surrounds. Even at a glance, anyone could recognize that no expense was spared in its creation.)

19.text: (Finely pruned and shaped hedges line the cobbled pathways, with not a single wilting piece of flora in sight.)

20.text: (You wouldn’t be surprised if it was like this even when a foreign diplomat or person of power wasn’t visiting. The people in this kingdom don’t play around when it comes to their plants.)

21.text: (The blossoming flowers are in no short supply either despite the gloomy sky of clouds that lumbers overhead. Emerald vines, the signature flower of the royal family, twist around arches and other structures.)

22.text: (You could come here every day and still not be satisfied upon departure.)

23.text: Ah. There you two lovebirds are!

25.text: (Out of the corner of your eye, you notice a grimace flash across Cassius’s face before he smoothly covers it up with another charming smile.)

26.text: (You then look toward the source of the booming voice.)

28.text: (You got so absorbed in the garden’s sights that you forgot you were here to meet with the royal family.)

29.text: (This…will be a whole new level of nerve-wracking compared to breakfast.)

31.text: (Who knows? One wrong move and it could be off with your head.)

32.speaker: King Octavian
32.text: Welcome, welcome! My lovely son and his darling bride-to-be, please make yourselves comfortable!

33.text: (Cassius bows his head, and taking the hint, you follow suit.)

34.speaker: Cassius
34.text: We thank you for your hospitality, Father.

35.speaker: King Octavian
35.text: No, no. Thank [i]you[/i] for taking time out of your busy schedules to have lunch with us. I know you both must be busy with your academy work.

37.speaker: King Octavian
37.text: Ah, the joys of youth, do you recall our academy days, My Dearest? Such exhilarating times!

38.text: (King Octavian lets out a hearty laugh. He’s a jovial man, always brimming with joy. It was almost like he could show no other emotion.)

39.text: (There were a few times when he cracked during [i]Full Blossom[/i], but those were typically in high-tension moments during the conclusion. Usually, he’d wear a cheery smile on his face and today is no different.)

40.text: (Sitting to his left is his wife, Queen Gisele. The same could not be said for her, however. Her gaze almost feels bitter as she glares straight at you.)

41.speaker: Queen Gisele
41.text: …Yes, I do. I’m sure your schedules must be hectic.

42.speaker: Queen Gisele
42.text: You barely made it before the food got cold, after all.

43.text: (You bite your tongue. Queen Gisele was always such a perfectionist.)

44.text: (She, like many others, saw Cecilia as a stain on noble society. While most people were rightfully judgemental about Cecilia, few ever voiced their opinions.)

45.text: (Queen Gisele was one of Cecilia’s most vocal critics and easily the harshest due to her engagement with Cassius. No one would ever be good enough to marry her son, especially not someone with Cecilia’s personality.)

46.text: (You expected the harsh treatment and cold words from her, but experiencing it firsthand fills you with an overwhelming sense of deja vu. First, it was Cassius, then Esra, and now Queen Giselle.)

47.text: (The moment you realized you were Cecilia, you knew that you would face numerous enemies. However, coming face to face with their scorn makes your heart ache.)

48.speaker: King Octavian
48.text: Now dear, don’t be like that.

49.speaker: King Octavian
49.text: They did make it in time.

51.text: (She gives you a warning glare as if to say [i]“Which is as good as late for figures of your positions.”[/i])

52.text: (The king attempts to laugh off her comment to relieve the atmosphere of its tension.)

53.text: (And precisely because he’s the king, it works.)

54.text: (In the game, King Octavian was always a peacekeeper. He was a minor character, always trying to remain neutral regarding his royal duties.)

55.text: (You sort of thought he was a bit too carefree considering the state of his nation, but right now you couldn’t be happier that he’s here.)

57.text: (You finally allow yourself to turn towards the final guest at the table.)

58.text: (There sits a tall, tanned man with long navy blue hair neatly swept into a braid. His hair and clothes are meticulously styled so that not a hair is out of place, but his dark eyebags paint another picture.)

59.text: (What’s most notable though, are his horns.)

62.text: (Is that [i]the [b]Demon Lord?[/b][/i] AKA the final boss in [i]Full Blossom?[/i] He’s the foreign diplomat?!)

63.speaker: King Octavian
63.text: Ah, yes! Where are my manners?

64.speaker: King Octavian
64.text: Now that we’re all seated, please let me introduce you to our distinguished guest.

65.speaker: King Octavian
65.text: Cassius, Cecilia. Meet Lord Akatius. He’s a royal envoy from the Demon Lands.

67.text: (Akatius, better known throughout the fandom as the Demon Lord and the final boss of [i]Full Blossom.[/i])

68.text: (He was a successful bureaucrat and scientist. After being sent to the human kingdom as a diplomat, he incited a war to destroy humanity.)

69.text: (He hoped it would grant him enough power and influence to take over the Demon Lands and claim the throne—thus gathering enough power to exterminate all human countries once and for all.)

70.text: (Though extreme in his plans, he was willing to sacrifice anything for his people. Some even saw his bloodthirst as endearing in a twisted sort of way.)

71.text: (Wait. You’re forgetting something else, aren’t you?)

72.text: (No matter how hard you wrack your brain for the last missing puzzle piece to this character, you continue to come up empty-handed. You’ll have to try again later when you’re not fighting for your life at a dining table.)

73.speaker: Lord Akatius
73.text: While it is a…[i]pleasure…[/i] to finally meet the two of you, I would prefer if we got this luncheon underway.

74.text: (You were certain that [i]Full Blossom[/i] made him out to be a being made of pure evil.)

75.text: (However, out of everyone at the table, it feels like you can resonate with him the most.)

76.text: (After all, he also sounds like he wants this lunch to end as soon as possible.)

77.options: “It is so great to meet you! I hope we can be good friends in the future.”|“What a rude greeting. Do you dislike the presence of humans that much?”|“The pleasure is all mine.”.|…I’ll just stay quiet.

83.speaker: Queen Gisele
83.text: We apologize for her rude behavior, Lord Akatius. She didn’t mean you any offense.

90.text: (This is going to be an uncomfortable lunch.)

91.text: (A few minutes pass without anyone speaking. Sitting in silence doesn’t seem to be the ideal way to spend this lunch.)

92.text: (However, given Cecilia’s reputation, anything you’d say would probably fall on flat ears.

93.speaker: King Octavian
93.text: Oh, to see this food leave everyone speechless!

94.speaker: King Octavian
94.text: It is great that everyone is enjoying the lunch, I’ll have to reward the chef handsomely!

95.speaker: King Octavian
95.text: But as this luncheon is a welcome to our new diplomat, I simply must know…

96.speaker: King Octavian
96.text: Lord Akatius—pray tell, how are you acclimating to human society?

99.speaker: Lord Akatius
99.text: It’s not like I do much differently here compared to anywhere else.

101.speaker: King Octavian
101.text: …What did you do in the Demon Lands before becoming a diplomat?

103.speaker: Lord Akatius
103.text: I studied the sciences, medicine and botany specifically.

104.speaker: King Octavian
104.text: Ah! So you’re interested in horticulture?

105.speaker: King Octavian
105.text: Our kingdom’s culture has [i]quite[/i] the history with flowers if you didn’t know.

109.text: (He might be too happy-go-lucky for his title, but no one could say King Octavian didn’t at least try to have a good relationship with the Demon Lands. His attempts at conversation are earnest, albeit ignorant.)

110.options: I feel bad for him. He’s giving it his best shot.|However…that doesn’t change how awkward this is. I’m not sure how much longer I can handle this conversation.|Hhe’s going through hell right now…but he doesn’t have anyone else to blame. He should've better educated himself beforehand.

112.speaker: King Octavian
112.text: If you don’t mind my prying, why don’t you tell me about your research?

113.text: (Lord Akatius’s eyes have a renewed glow hearing the question.)

114.speaker: Lord Akatius
114.text: My previous study focused primarily on developing new methods of utilizing plants to improve medical efficacy. For example, I found that quickly boiling alchemical ingredients can increase the potency of certain tonics.

115.speaker: Lord Akatius
115.text: It is quite an interesting phenomenon actually. I would love to go more in-depth explaining why this happens. You see—

116.speaker: King Octavian
116.text: No need to be quite so detailed with us amateurs.

117.speaker: King Octavian
117.text: Perhaps you could share a different aspect of your research.

118.text: (The light in Lord Akatius’s eyes dims a little at the king’s response.)

120.speaker: Lord Akatius
120.text: Well, I suppose I could. My research is quite expansive.

121.speaker: Lord Akatius
121.text: Is anyone at the table interested in a particular topic?

122.options: "How do you receive funding for your research?"|"Do you have any research involving more unusual plants?"|"Actually—I’d like to hear more details about the research you mentioned beforehand."|I shouldn’t say anything and just leave this responsibility to the royal family.

124.speaker: Lord Akatius
124.text: As a researcher for the Demon Lands, I receive a stipend each month.

125.speaker: Lord Akatius
125.text: I imagine it isn’t any different from the government programs you have here.

126.speaker: "Cecilia"
126.text: During certain months, do you ever find your finances run a bit short?

128.speaker: Lord Akatius
128.text: Not particularly. During months when my budget ran short, my vassals would design fundraising events.

129.speaker: Lord Akatius
129.text: I dislike asking the general public for donations, so I only do it when it is truly necessary.

130.speaker: Lord Akatius
130.text: Nonetheless, my people are more than happy to step up in the name of advancement. I am quite proud of them in that regard.

132.speaker: Lord Akatius
132.text: Lady Karmina, I am familiar with your reputation.

133.speaker: Lord Akatius
133.text: And while I do appreciate your interest, I do not wish to make business dealings involving my research.

134.speaker: Lord Akatius
134.text: Just as my people have given to me, I only want my research to give back to them and I’ve found that bureaucracy tends to trample over that wish.

135.speaker: Lord Akatius
135.text: So, if you would excuse my bluntness, I am not looking to start a partnership with you or any other human merchants.

136.text: (…It doesn’t seem like Lord Akatius is all too interested in this topic.)

137.text: (And it seems like the royal family doesn’t appreciate my attempts to talk money either. Queen Giselle can’t hide her scowl anymore and Cassius won’t even look in my direction.)

138.speaker: Lord Akatius
138.text: If anyone else has [i]any[/i] other questions, I’d be more than willing to answer.

139.speaker: "Cecilia"
139.text: Yes, unusual. Something you couldn’t find in the kingdom.

140.speaker: "Cecilia"
140.text: I’ve heard rumors of dangerous and poisonous plants in the Demon Lands.

141.speaker: "Cecilia"
141.text: I only wish to confirm the validity of these statements.

142.text: (King Octavian goes white as a sheet at the question while Cassius and Queen Giselle have a look of pure disgust on their faces. Maybe you chose the wrong topic to pursue.)

144.speaker: Lord Akatius
144.text: I’ve never met a human interested in learning about new species before.

145.speaker: Lord Akatius
145.text: I’ve heard about your reputation, Lady Karmina, but you are quite different from how you are described.

146.text: (Lord Akatius’s face remains unchanged. At least it doesn’t seem like you’ve gotten on his bad side.)

147.speaker: Lord Akatius
147.text: Alas, this topic isn’t suitable for a dining table. At least, that’s what I was told at my last banquet.

148.speaker: Lord Akatius
148.text: I will say that the ecological landscapes of our two nations are much more similar than gossip suggests and leave it at that.

149.text: (A wave of relief washes over the faces of the entire royal family.)

150.speaker: Lord Akatius
150.text: That isn’t to say there aren’t any different species.

151.speaker: Lord Akatius
151.text: In fact, I have seen plenty of [i]unusual[/i] plants during my years of research.

152.speaker: Lord Akatius
152.text: When you have the time, visit my study.

153.speaker: Lord Akatius
153.text: Normally, I dislike having visitors while I’m conducting my experiments, but you’re the first human to show interest in my research.

154.speaker: Lord Akatius
154.text: I’ll make an exception for you.

155.text: (It seems like you’ve made a good first impression. Maybe you can take advantage of this in the future.)

156.text: (If you get close to him, you might be able to prevent him from becoming the [b]Demon Lord[/b] in the future, and suddenly you’d have one less problem to worry about.)

157.speaker: Lord Akatius
157.text: If anyone else has any other questions, I’d be more than willing to answer.

158.speaker: Lord Akatius
158.text: Ah, yes. Well, it is quite simple really. Most living beings are quite bad at absorbing mana from the natural world. While some, for example demons, have developed bodies that are more capable of drawing in mana than others, they are still relatively inefficient.

159.text: (Lord Akatius’s elaborate science jargon is lost on you, but it’d be rude of you to interrupt him now. After all, you did ask for this. You made your bed, now you have to lay in it.)

160.text: (Minutes pass and Lord Akatius barely stops speaking for even a breath. You turn to look at Cassius, but he’s completely spaced out. It’s quite a shame that no one else seems to be listening. He’s obviously quite passionate about his research.)

162.speaker: Lord Akatius
162.text: —and by boiling the ingredients before making our medicine, we break down the structures that hold mana, thereby making it easier to absorb. Of course, there is more nuance to it than that. The amount of time spent boiling is incredibly important.

163.speaker: Lord Akatius
163.text: Additionally, not all ingredients show this response. It is mostly plants that I have found this in, but even then not all plants respond in this manner. I can go into this as well if you’d like to hear.

164.speaker: Queen Gisele
164.text: Your research is quite fascinating, Lord Akatius.

165.speaker: Queen Gisele
165.text: However, we should perhaps discuss that topic another time.

166.speaker: Queen Gisele
166.text: We wouldn’t want to spoil all of the fun now.

167.text: (Lord Akatius looks disappointed by the queen’s disinterest in his research.)

169.speaker: Lord Akatius
169.text: Well, if anyone else has any other questions, I’d be more than willing to answer.

171.text: (The king gives turns to Cassius and myself. The look in his eyes almost begs for help.)

173.speaker: Lord Akatius
173.text: To be frank, I don’t care much for politics. However, I have an obligation to help my people.

174.speaker: Lord Akatius
174.text: The soil in the Demon Lands is being drained and it has become unable to sustain much of our flora. Comparing our topography, human farmlands will soon face the same issue.

175.speaker: Lord Akatius
175.text: I believe I can find a solution to our mutual problem by studying human agriculture.

176.text: (The aura around Lord Akatius transforms into something much more somber, it is completely different from any point in the conversation prior.)

177.text: (His air of apathy and discomfort has dispersed, replaced by a deep sorrow.)

181.text: (King Octavian looks around, but refuses to make eye contact with anyone. Queen Gisele coldly glares at Cassius while his head hangs low and he stares straight into his plate. It seems like no one else wants to attempt any small talk after that.)

182.text: (The tension in the air is palpable. You should leave as soon as possible. Sitting through this awkwardness any longer might be the death of you.)

letdrag.text: (Cassius grabs your arm in what is now becoming his signature suffocating grip. He doesn’t even spare you a moment to adjust before he’s yanking you down the halls.)

pullaway.text: (Cassius raises an eyebrow. You guess Cecilia would never normally back away from him.)

fake1.speaker: King Octavian
fake1.text: Haha! I’m glad to see you’ve taken such an interest in our kingdom.

funding.text: (Cassius turns toward me, his face almost saying [i]”How did I know you would ask that?”[/i])

research.text: (The color drains from the king’s face as he processes your words, but you seem to have caught Lord Akatius’s interest at the very least.)

rejoin.speaker: Cassius
rejoin.text: If you’re so passionate about your research, why have you come here as a diplomat?
